content:
Namaste! I'd be happy to help you find a yoga app that challenges you with more advanced poses and sequences. Here are some top-rated options:

1. **YogaGlo**: Offers a wide range of classes, including advanced Vinyasa, Ashtanga, and Restorative yoga. Classes are taught by experienced instructors, and you can filter by level, style, and focus (e.g., backbends, inversions, or arm balances).
2. **Alo Moves**: Features a variety of classes, including advanced yoga, Pilates, and meditation. Their advanced yoga classes focus on complex sequences, transitions, and breathwork. They also offer a "Challenge" series, which is perfect for experienced yogis.
3. **Gaia**: This app offers a vast library of yoga classes, including advanced Hatha, Vinyasa, and Kundalini yoga. You can filter by level, style, and focus, and they also have a "Challenge" section with more advanced sequences.
4. **Do You Yoga**: This app features classes taught by experienced instructors, including advanced classes focused on inversions, arm balances, and deep backbends. They also offer a "Yoga Pro" section with more challenging sequences.
5. **Pocket Yoga**: This app offers a comprehensive yoga practice with advanced classes, including Ashtanga, Vinyasa, and Restorative yoga. You can also create your own custom sequences and track your progress.
6. **Cody**: This app features classes taught by experienced instructors, including advanced yoga, Pilates, and meditation. They offer a "Challenge" series, and you can filter classes by level, style, and focus.
7. **Omstars**: This app offers a variety of yoga classes, including advanced Vinyasa, Hatha, and Restorative yoga. They also feature classes focused on specific areas, like core strength, flexibility, and balance.

Before committing to a subscription, you may want to try out a few of these apps to see which one resonates with you the most. Many of them offer free trials or introductory periods, so take advantage of those to test the content and style.

Remember to always listen to your body and modify or rest when needed, even in advanced classes. Happy practicing!
